ud1.8:1: Thus I heard:At one time the Gracious One was dwelling near Sāvatthī, in Jeta's Wood, at Anāthapiṇḍika's monastery. Then at that time venerable Sangāmajī had arrived at Sāvatthī to see the Gracious One.
ud1.8:2: Then at that time venerable Sangāmajī was dwelling for the day sat at the root of a certain tree. Then venerable Sangāmajī's former wife went to venerable Sangāmajī, and after going, she said to venerable Sangāmajī: "I have a little son, ascetic, you must take care of me."
ud1.8:3: For a second time venerable Sangāmajī's former wife said to venerable Sangāmajī: "I have a little son, ascetic, you must take care of me."
ud1.8:4: For a third time venerable Sangāmajī's former wife said to venerable Sangāmajī: "I have a little son, ascetic, you must take care of me."
ud1.8:5: Then venerable Sangāmajī's former wife, having put the boy down in front of venerable Sangāmajī, went away,saying: "This is your son, ascetic, you must take care of him."
ud1.8:6: But venerable Sangāmajī did not look at the boy, nor did he speakto him.
ud1.8:7: Then the Gracious One, having understood the significance of it, on that occasion uttered this exalted utterance:
ud1.8:8: "Inhercoming he does not rejoice, inherleaving he does not grieve,Sangāmajī ‘Victorious in Battle’, free from the shackle: him I call a brāhmaṇa."
